com.whirlycott.cache
Interface Cacheable

public interface Cacheable

This is an optional interface for object keys which may be stored in the cache. After each retrieve(), store() or remove() operation for a particular Cache, the corresponding method of the object implementing this interface is called. The onRemove(), onStore() and onRetrieve() methods are called both by cache policies and regular client calls on the Cache interface (i.e. operations within policies also call these methods). Implementing this interface will not result in any performance increase. On the contrary, additional work per Cache operation will only serve to slow things down.

Author:
Philip Jacob phil@whirlycott.com
